description: This course examines American life, politics, and foreign policy from the Cold War to the present. Using a variety of readings, students explore some of the contradictions of modernity and the transformation of America into a post-industrial society. Offered periodically. Counts toward American studies major. Prerequisite: HIST 199 recommended.
name: Sem: Race/Capitalism Modern U.S.
notes: This course includes an academic civic engagement (ACE) component.
title: Problems of Contemporary America
